intro: Galium acutissimum, commonly known as sharpstem bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white to pale pink flowers during the summer months. Its fruit is a small, two-lobed capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature. Galium acutissimum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
